name: Bacon
description: Strips of crispy, fatty, reddish-brown bacon, as fried for breakfast. Depicted as a pair on most platforms.

name: Hamburger
description: A burger with a beef patty, usually depicted on a sesame bun with cheese, lettuce, and tomato—making it a cheeseburger, though officially called Hamburger by Unicode.

name: French Fries
description: Thin-cut, golden-brown French fries, served in a red carton, as at McDonald’s. Apple features Smiling Face With Smiling Eyes on its carton.

name: Pizza
description: A slice of pepperoni pizza, previously also topped with black olives on Google. WhatsApp adds green pepper, Samsung white onion.

name: Hot Dog
description: The cooked sausage of a hot dog in a sliced bun and drizzled with yellow mustard, as eaten at a baseball game.

name: Sandwich
description: A sandwich, as eaten at lunch, made with lettuce, tomato, and cheese on slices of white or wheat bread. Apple, Google, and WhatsApp add a deli meat that resembles ham.

name: Taco
description: A Mexican or Tex-Mex taco on a hard or soft corn tortilla, filled with such ingredients as beef, lettuce, tomato, cheese, and onion. Apple’s design resembles a carne asada taco, with cilantro and white onion.

name: Burrito
description: A Mexican or Tex-Mex burrito, featuring a wrapped flour tortilla filled with such ingredients as beef, rice, beans, cheese, tomato, lettuce, and sour cream. Served in foil on several major platforms, suggesting a Mission burrito associated with San Francisco. Not to be confused with the Stuffed Flatbread.

name: Tamale
description: A single tamale wrapped in a corn husk.

name: Stuffed Flatbread
description: A flatbread, like pita, stuffed with lettuce, tomato, and/or meat. Resembles a doner kebab, falafel, shawarma, or gyro sandwich, popular in the Middle East and the Mediterranean. Some platforms have red onion and cucumber. Not to be confused with 🫓 Flatbread or 🌯 Burrito.

name: Falafel
description: Brown spheres depicting falafel, a food popular in Middle Eastern and North African cuisine, typically made of mashed chickpeas or fava beans. Most platforms include three or more falafel with one piece split open to reveal a green center. Can be used to talk about falafel and possibly other round brown food items like meatballs.

name: Egg
description: An egg, displayed as a chicken egg with a white or light brown shell. Commonly used at Easter time. See also: 🍳 Cooking.

name: Cooking
description: An egg with yolk frying in a skillet, as prepared sunny-side up. Though associated with breakfast, the emoji represents the general action of cooking and related concepts.

name: Shallow Pan of Food
description: A flat, shallow, black pan with side handles, containing saffron-colored rice, vegetables, a leg of poultry, and/or shrimp and lemon slices. Commonly associated with paella, a traditional dish from Spain. May be used for eating, cooking, dining, and meals more generally.

name: Pot of Food
description: A pot, as a casserole dish, filled with a warm and hearty beef or vegetable stew on most platforms. Generally used for eating and cooking (“a meal”), and commonly associated with soup or Japanese nabe.

name: Fondue
description: A red fondue pot. Most platforms show cheese fondue with fondue forks sticking out of the pot.

name: Bowl with Spoon
description: A bowl with a silver spoon inside, as used to eat cereal or soup. Bowl color varies across platforms, as do contents, though most are empty.

name: Green Salad
description: An undressed garden salad in a bowl with leafy-green lettuce and other ingredients such as tomato, red onion, and black olives. Commonly associated with healthy eating and living.

name: Popcorn
description: The buttery-white snack of popcorn brimming in a classic red-and-white-striped carton, as enjoyed at a movie theater.

name: Butter
description: A pale yellow stick of butter. Can be used to talk about cooking or eating. Might also be used in idioms or to reference something that is smooth.

name: Salt
description: A clear glass shaker of salt with a silver cap, as paired with pepper to season food when eating at a restaurant.

name: Canned Food
description: A can or tin of food, depicted as tomatoes or a generic green vegetable. May be also used to represent sauce or soup.

name: Bento Box
description: A Japanese bento, a lunch box divided into portions of rice, vegetables, and meat or seafood, such as sushi or fried shrimp.

name: Rice Cracker
description: A Japanese senbei, or rice cracker, wrapped with a sheet of nori, or seaweed, a snack commonly enjoyed with green tea.

name: Rice Ball
description: A Japanese onigiri, a cone-shaped ball of white rice, a snack wrapped with a sheet of nori, or seaweed.

name: Cooked Rice
description: A bowl of steamed white rice, a staple component of cuisine throughout Asia. Bowl color varies across platforms, though is often white.

name: Curry Rice
description: A plate of orange-brown curry with vegetables or meat, served with a mound of white rice. May represent kare-raisu, or Japanese curry, though commonly associated with India and other Asian cuisines.

name: Steaming Bowl
description: A bowl of steaming-hot food. Depicted as Japanese ramen (noodles in broth) with chopsticks on most platforms, though it can represent a warm meal more generally.

name: Spaghetti
description: A plate of Italian spaghetti with tomato sauce, as a bolognese, with a fork twirling its long, thin noodles. Garnished with a green herb, as parsley, on some platforms.

name: Roasted Sweet Potato
description: A sweet potato depicted with textured purple, orange, or brown skin and sliced in half to show its golden-brown flesh. Sometimes called a yam, though they are unrelated. Not to be confused with the Potato.

name: Oden
description: A skewer of three bites of Japanese oden, a winter dish made with fishcakes, tofu, konnyaku, and a variety of other ingredients, including boiled eggs. Often served as a stew or skewered and dipped into soy sauce. Resembles the Dango and may be used for other skewered foods (e.g., shish kebab, roasting marshmallows) or spears.

name: Sushi
description: Japanese sushi, generally depicted as two pieces of raw pinkish-orange fish, as tuna or salmon, on white rice (nigiri). Some platforms show the cylindrical maki, a piece of seafood, vegetables, and white rice wrapped in seaweed (nori).

name: Fried Shrimp
description: A prawn or shrimp breaded and deep-fried golden-brown. Known as ebi furai in Japan but commonly called shrimp tempura and served in a bento box. Not to be confused with the Shrimp.

name: Fish Cake with Swirl
description: A slice of Japanese narutomaki, a ridged fishcake of processed whitefish with an iconic pink swirl, often served in ramen or oden. Thanks to its distinct swirl, may be used for flair.

name: Moon Cake
description: The round, golden-brown pastry of a Chinese mooncake, a traditional delicacy and lunar symbol of the Mid-Autumn Festival. Many platforms feature a design or character imprinted on the crust, and depict a slice cut out to show a brown paste with a duck egg yolk inside. Twitter displays the Chinese character for “fall/autumn” or “harvest” (秋) on top.

name: Dango
description: A Japanese sweet dumpling made from rice flour and served on a skewer. Depicted as a botchan dango, comprising a pink, white or light yellow, and green ball, as colored by red beans, egg, and green tea. Resembles the Oden and featured in the Moon Viewing Ceremony, used in the Japanese festival to celebrate the full moon.

name: Dumpling
description: A dumpling of dough and filling, as folded and pinched closed for steaming or frying. Associated with cuisines around the world, including China (jiaozi), Japan (gyoza or dango), Poland (pierogi), and Spain and Latin America (empanada).

name: Fortune Cookie
description: A golden-brown, crescent-shaped, vanilla-flavored fortune cookie. Usually depicted with a strip of paper—on which a wise saying, lucky numbers, or Chinese vocabulary is written—peaking out of its hollow shell. Given at the end of meals at Chinese restaurants in the West.

name: Takeout Box
description: A tall, folded, paper carton, usually white, as used for takeout/takeaway food at Western Chinese restaurants. Most platforms depict chopsticks inside its open lid, labeled with a red, multi-tiered, traditional Chinese building. Also called an oyster pail.

name: Crab
description: A crab, a squat crustacean with pincers. Depicted as a reddish-orange crab (as cooked) shown from above, with a round, shelled body, shorted, tentacle-like eyes, and ten legs, the top two of which are large pincers.

name: Lobster
description: A lobster, a large crustacean with a prominent tail and pincers. Depicted as a reddish-orange lobster (as cooked) from above, with a long body and tail, short, tentacle-like eyes, and ten legs, the top of which are very large pincers.

name: Shrimp
description: A shrimp (prawn), a small crustacean with a long tail. Generally depicted as a reddish-orange shrimp (as cooked) in full profile facing left, with tiny eyes, many limbs, and its long antennae curling back as its long tail curls in.

name: Squid
description: A squid, an octopus-like sea animal with ten arms. Generally depicted as a pinkish-orange giant squid, facing forward or angled to the left, with a slender, arrow-like body, small eyes, and two, long arms raised up at its sides. Platforms generally depict six arms.

name: Oyster
description: Half of an opened oyster shell with gray, pink, or orange flesh inside. Many platforms also include a pearl in the shell.

name: Soft Ice Cream
description: A swirl of soft-serve ice cream atop a wafer-style cone, white or cream-colored, as vanilla, on most platforms. Facebook’s design suggests strawberry. May be used more generally for ice cream, frozen yogurt, and frozen treats.

name: Shaved Ice
description: A mound of shaved ice (snow cone) served in a dessert bowl with a short spoon, flavored with a cherry-red syrup on many platforms. Associated with Hawaiian shave ice or Japanese kakigori.

name: Ice Cream
description: One or more scoops of ice cream in a dessert bowl, variously topped with sprinkles, wafer rolls, or cherry and syrup. Flavors vary from vanilla, chocolate, and/or strawberry across platforms.

name: Doughnut
description: A chocolate-glazed donut (or doughnut) with rainbow sprinkles. WhatsApp features a pink glaze associated with The Simpsons. May resemble the Bagel at small sizes.

name: Cookie
description: A golden-brown chocolate chip cookie or biscuit. Used to represent cookies or biscuits in general.

name: Birthday Cake
description: A frosted cake with lit candles, as presented for a birthday celebration. The style of cake widely varies across platforms. With white frosting and strawberries, Apple and Google’s designs suggest a Japanese Christmas cake. Other vendors depict a chocolate, pink, and/or sponge cake.

name: Shortcake
description: A slice of strawberry shortcake, layered with whipped cream and topped with a whole strawberry. Like the Birthday Cake, may be used to represent birthday celebrations or cake in general.

name: Cupcake
description: An individual cupcake in a liner topped with a swirl of frosting and sprinkles. The style of cupcake widely varies across platforms. The cake may be sponge or chocolate, the frosting pink or white, and the sprinkles rainbow or red.

name: Pie
description: A baked dish with a pastry crust, filled with sweet or savory ingredients. Appearance widely varies by platform.

name: Chocolate Bar
description: A block of dark chocolate, usually shown in a red foil wrapper peeled back to show squares of the candy. WhatsApp displays the wrapper in purple, a color commonly associated with Cadbury chocolate.

name: Candy
description: A small piece of candy wrapped in plastic or wax paper with twists on its ends. Shape and color vary widely by platform. Facebook’s design used to resemble a classic unwrapped red-and-white peppermint. May also be called sweets or lollies.

name: Lollipop
description: A colorful lollipop made of swirled hard candy attached to a stick. Colors vary by platform, though most designs show rainbow colors or pinks and reds.

name: Custard
description: A golden-yellow custard dessert, as a crème caramel or flan, topped with a layer of caramel. Shown on a plate, molded in a ramekin-shape and often in a pool of caramel sauce.

name: Honey Pot
description: A golden-yellow pot of honey, as made by bees and desired by bears. Shown with the sweet substance oozing down its sides, often with a honey dipper inside the small vessel.

name: Baby Bottle
description: A bottle of milk or formula, as or fed to a baby, with a bluish cap and rubber nipple or teat. Positioned upright or at a 45° angle, and filled to various levels, sometimes showing fill lines. Often used for newborns and childrearing. See also Breast-Feeding.

name: Glass of Milk
description: A tall glass of white milk, as from a cow but also other mammals, nuts, or plants. Most platforms depict a glass filled near to the brim, but some show a glass half-full—or half-empty.

name: Hot Beverage
description: A cup of a steaming-hot beverage, usually taken as coffee or tea. Sometimes shown on a saucer.

name: Teapot
description: A classic teapot with a wide bulbous body, a spout, a handle, and a lid. Can be used to talk about tea, tea time, or warm beverages in general.

name: Teacup Without Handle
description: A cup of green tea, as the minty-colored Japanese matcha, usually shown on a wooden mat. Matcha is traditionally served in a small bowl that resembles a cup without a handle. Often taken as a bowl of soup, such as a split pea.

name: Sake
description: Japanese sake, an alcoholic beverage made from rice. Shown as a sake set with a carafe (tokkuri) and drinking cup (choko). Most platforms show a cream colored sake set with a blue or red stripe motif. Samsung's design used to show the Japanese script for 'sake' in red along the side of the carafe.

name: Bottle with Popping Cork
description: A green bottle of champagne or sparkling wine with label, its cork popping to shoot out its bubbly contents. Used for a range of celebratory occasions, such as New Year's Eve, birthdays, weddings, or other life accomplishments.

name: Wine Glass
description: Red wine served in a stemmed glass. Google previously displayed an orange-colored drink that resembled cognac.

name: Cocktail Glass
description: A stemmed glass with a cone-shaped bowl, used for serving cocktails. Depicted as a martini garnished with an olive. Might be gin or vodka, shaken or stirred. See also Tropical Drink.

name: Tropical Drink
description: A sunset-orange-colored tropical beverage in a stemmed glass, as a rum punch or mai tai. Served with a straw and fruit garnish. Many platforms include a cocktail umbrella, hence umbrella drink. Samsung previously featured an electric-blue concoction. See also Cocktail Glass.

name: Beer Mug
description: A beer, as a golden-colored lager, in a frosty mug. Depicted with a frothy head spilling over the brim. 🍻 Clinking Beer Mugs is a variation that displays two such beer mugs.

name: Clinking Beer Mugs
description: Two frosty mugs of beer with frothy heads being clinked together, as done at a celebratory or convivial toast (“Cheers!”). Several platforms include stylized lines to mark the clinking. See also 🥂 Clinking Glasses.

name: Clinking Glasses
description: Two flutes of champagne or sparkling wine being clinked together, as done at a celebratory or convivial toast (“Cheers!”). Samsung’s design suggests two glasses of white wine. Some platforms include stylized links to mark the clinking. See also Clinking Beer Mugs—and Bottle With Popping Cork for a refill.

name: Tumbler Glass
description: A short, flat glass, as used for brown liquors like whiskey or Scotch whisky.

name: Pouring Liquid
description: A glass pouring liquid.

name: Cup with Straw
description: A drinking cup with a straw. Depicted on many platforms as a disposable cup with a lid and bendy straw, as used to serve soft drinks at fast-food restaurants. May be used for a range of non-alcoholic beverages, including milkshakes, smoothies, juice, and to-go beverages.

name: Bubble Tea
description: Bubble tea is a tea-based drink invented in Taiwan which typically contain tea, flavored milk, and sugar. Commonly served with tapioca pearls, also known as boba, in a plastic cup with a wide straw.

name: Beverage Box
description: Originally proposed as Juice, this emoji can be used to talk about juice or other liquids that come in boxes with straws. It can also be used metaphorically to talk about power, energy, respect, or an elusive quality that makes someone special.

name: Mate
description: Mate is a caffeinated beverage popular in many South American countries. Green in color (from a key ingredient: the dried leaves of yerba mate) and consumed via a metal straw.

name: Ice
description: A blue cube of ice. Can be used to talk about ice or cold temperatures in general. This emoji can also be used metaphorically to talk about something that is cool or chill.

name: Chopsticks
description: A pair of equal-length chopsticks, an eating utensil used throughout East Asia. Design and color vary widely by platform, though often red or wood-colored and with tips angled together. Featured in many platforms' Steaming Bowl of Food and Takeout Box. A counterpart to utensils such as Fork and Knife and Spoon.

name: Fork and Knife with Plate
description: A silver fork and knife on either side of a white plate, as set for dinner or another meal. Often used more generally for eating and dining. May be paired with Spoon.

name: Fork and Knife
description: A silver fork to the left of a knife, silverware or cutlery used to eat a meal. Often used more generally for eating and dining. May be paired with Spoon or used with Fork and Knife With Plate.

name: Spoon
description: A silver spoon, as used to eat soup, cereal, or ice cream as well as serve food or stir drinks. Positioned at various angles across platforms. May be paired with Fork and Knife, Fork and Knife With Plate, and Bowl With Spoon.

name: Kitchen Knife
description: A knife with a long steel blade, as a chef uses to slice meat or vegetables. Depicted with a black or brown handle and positioned at a 45° angle, often with its point at the lower right.

name: Jar
description: An empty glass jar.

name: Amphora
description: A tall, ceramic jar with two handles and a narrow neck and foot. Represents an amphora, as used by ancient Greeks and Romans to hold water and wine.

name: Globe Showing Europe-Africa
description: A globe, showing the continents of Europe and Africa in green against blue ocean.

name: Globe Showing Americas
description: A globe, showing the continents of North and South America in green against blue ocean.

name: Globe Showing Asia-Australia
description: A globe, showing the continents of Asia and Australia in green against blue ocean.

name: Globe with Meridians
description: A stylized globe, with blue meridians (longitudes) and latitude. Depicted with light-blue grid of lines on a white, blue, or empty circle.

name: World Map
description: A rectangular map of the world. Generally depicted as a paper map creased at its folds, Earth’s surface shown in green on blue ocean.

name: Map of Japan
description: Shows a map of the country of Japan, which is the only country to have its own emoji map. Other countries can be found on the various globe emojis, or the world map emoji.

name: Compass
description: A magnetic compass, as used for navigation. Generally depicted in a silver or gold case with a compass rose and a red-tipped needle. Commonly used for various content concerning traveling and exploring as well as metaphorical compasses (e.g., moral compass).

name: Snow-Capped Mountain
description: A mountain with snow resting at higher altitudes. Similar in appearance to the Mount Fuji emoji.

name: Mountain
description: A mountain shown with two peaks and blue sky. Similar to the snow capped mountain emoji.

name: Volcano
description: A volcano, erupting with smoke and lava.

name: Mount Fuji
description: Mount Fuji (called Fuji-san in Japan) is the largest mountain in Japan. Often seen with snow on the peak in colder months of the year.

name: Camping
description: A campsite featuring a tent and a tree, and perhaps a campfire. Similar to the tent emoji.

name: Beach with Umbrella
description: A beach showing sand, and an umbrella for protection from the sun.

name: Desert
description: Desert was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Desert Island
description: Desert Island was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: National Park
description: A national park, generally displayed with mountains, a river or stream, and trees.

name: Stadium
description: A large capacity stadium, featuring a large amount of seating for sporting fans, or people attending other shows hosted by the stadium.

name: Classical Building
description: A building shown with columns in a classical style, sometimes used to represent a courthouse, town hall, post office or stock exchange.

name: Building Construction
description: A construction site generally depicted as a tower crane shown lifting steel or other building materials.

name: Brick
description: A red brick or bricks. Depicted in a loose stack, a single object with holes, or as built into wall, as of a house, school, or other structure.

name: Rock
description: A large rock the size of a small rock. May be considered a boulder, a rock, a stone, a pebble, or a piece of dirt. The scale and meaning are context dependent.

name: Wood
description: One or two stumps of wood, cut so the rings are showing. Can be used to talk about wood or building materials.

name: Hut
description: A round hut with a thatched roof. Used to talk about huts, cottages, yurts, or homes in general.

name: Houses
description: Multiple houses.

name: Derelict House
description: A house which is unoccupied, and has become derelict. In a state of disrepair.

name: House
description: A house, otherwise known as a home when someone is living in it. Suitable for a couple or larger family, other perhaps housemates.

name: House with Garden
description: A suburban-looking house, with a tree, flower, or shrubs around it in the garden.

name: Office Building
description: A generic, high-rise office building. Generally found in cities, and most active during business hours.

name: Japanese Post Office
description: A Japanese post office, featuring the 〒 Japanese postal mark on the front of the building.

name: Post Office
description: A European-style post office. A postal horn can be seen on the front, which is commonly found in the logos of European Postal Services.

name: Hospital
description: A place where people are taken to receive medical care. This hospital has a large red cross on the front, often used as a symbol for health care.

name: Bank
description: A retail bank branch, where people can perform money-related tasks. Also a common location to find an ATM.

name: Hotel
description: A hotel building, displayed on most platforms as a building with many windows and a letter H on the front.

name: Love Hotel
description: A love hotel is a hotel that can be hired by the hour instead of as accommodation for the evening.

name: Convenience Store
description: A shop that is generally open for longer hours than a regular supermarket, sometimes 24 hours per day.

name: School
description: A school building with multiple storeys, and a clock on the front. A place that children, or teenagers attend for their education.

name: Department Store
description: A large department store, selling a range of products to the general public. Shown as a large building with a billboard.

name: Factory
description: An industrial factory, with flue-gas stacks releasing exhaust into the air.

name: Japanese Castle
description: A traditional Japanese Castle (城, shiro or jō), usually made from stone and wood.

name: Castle
description: A castle, in a style that can be found in France and other parts of Europe.

name: Wedding
description: An emoji to depict a wedding, displayed by most vendors as a Christian church and love hearts. Some platforms display a cross or bell on the building.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: The Tokyo Tower is the second-tallest building in Japan, located in Minato, Tokyo.

name: Statue of Liberty
description: The Statue of Liberty, often used as a depiction of New York City.

name: Church
description: A church building, generally associated with Christian denominations. In addition quiet prayer, churches hold regular worship services, weddings, baptisms and funerals.

name: Mosque
description: A mosque building, a place of worship for followers of Islam. Shown with a domed roof and a minaret.

name: Hindu Temple
description: A Hindu temple or mandir; a place of worship for followers of Hinduism. Depicted on most platforms as a red, orange, or golden building with a tall spire.

name: Synagogue
description: A synague; a place of worship for followers of Judaism. Displayed with a Star of David on the front.

name: Shinto Shrine
description: A shrine used for the Japanese Shinto religion. This emoji generally displays the torii, which is the gate to the Shinto Shrine. The torii is generally a red colored structure, with a curved roof section above two posts.

name: Kaaba
description: A cube-shaped building located at the centre of the Al-Masjid al-Haram Mosque in Mecca.

name: Fountain
description: A water fountain, found in a park or other public space. Used for decorative purposes. A variety of styles of fountain are shown across different platforms.

name: Tent
description: A tent, used for protection from wind and rain when camping.

name: Foggy
description: Foggy weather displayed as fog covering a bridge or cityscape, depending on the platform. For platforms that show a bridge, the red Golden Gate Bridge is generally displayed.

name: Night with Stars
description: A night sky with stars, depicted on major platforms as a cityscape at night.

name: Cityscape
description: Cityscape was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Sunrise Over Mountains
description: The sun rising over a mountain range, early in the morning.

name: Sunrise
description: A sun rising, early in the morning. Can be difficult to distinguish from a sunset in some versions of this artwork.

name: Cityscape at Dusk
description: A view of city buildings as the last light disappears from the sky. An orange (or blue) glow lingers, before the stars of the night sky become visible.

name: Sunset
description: A beautiful view, featuring an orange sky, with the sun setting over the buildings of a city skyline.

name: Bridge at Night
description: A lit-up bridge, shown at night.

name: Hot Springs
description: Representation of hot springs with steam rising from a circular tub. This is the common symbol used to represent an onsen on maps in Japan.

name: Carousel Horse
description: A wooden painted horse, found on the carousel at a carnival. Faces to the left-of screen.

name: Playground Slide
description: A slide with a ladder, as seen in children's playgrounds.

name: Ferris Wheel
description: A large rotating wheel, often found at a carnival or fair.

name: Roller Coaster
description: A roller coaster in a theme park going down a dip in the ride. Three carriages can be seen with two people in each red carriage.

name: Barber Pole
description: A pole spiraled with red, white, and blue stripes, as spins out front of a barbershop. Commonly used for various content concerning haircutting and hairstyling.

name: Circus Tent
description: A circular ‘big top’ circus tent, with a triangle flag on top.

name: Locomotive
description: A steam train, powered by coal or wood. An early type of locomotive, now mostly replaced by electric or diesel trains.

name: Railway Car
description: A railway (railroad) car (carriage) that is generally pulled along a railway line by a locomotive. Shown with a pantograph above the carriage on many platforms which makes it look more like a tram car.

name: High-Speed Train
description: A high speed train, designed to cover long distances at high speed.

name: Bullet Train
description: A high speed train, designed to cover long distances at high speed. Also features a streamlined bullet nose, often used in reference to the Shinkansen in Japan.

name: Train
description: A train, of no specified type. Due to the presence of a steam train and fast train emoji, this is likely to be a regular electrified or diesel passenger train.

name: Metro
description: A metro: frequent underground train found in built-up areas with high populations.

name: Light Rail
description: A form of public transport similar to a tram, but running on a track or network separated from cars and other types of traffic.

name: Station
description: A station, presumed to be a train station. Displays a train alongside a platform, where passengers can board.

name: Tram
description: A form of public transport on rails, usually found on streets in cities or other urban areas. For short or medium-length journeys.

name: Monorail
description: Similar to a train, but running on a single track. Monorails are often found at theme parks, or other tourist destinations.

name: Mountain Railway
description: A train and railway in the mountains.

name: Tram Car
description: A form of public transport on rails, usually found on streets in cities or other urban areas. For short or medium-length journeys.

name: Bus
description: A bus used for public transport in cities and towns. Could also be used as a school bus.

name: Oncoming Bus
description: The front of a bus, showing the windscreen, as well as wing mirrors in some versions of this emoji.

name: Trolleybus
description: A type of bus that uses overhead electrical wires for power. Appears similar to a cross between a bus and a tram car.

name: Minibus
description: A small bus or minivan designed to carry fewer people than a full-sized bus. Displayed in white on most platforms (green on Facebook).

name: Ambulance
description: An ambulance, used to transport patients between their home and the hospital.

name: Fire Engine
description: A red fire truck, an essential part of emergency services along with a police car or ambulance.

name: Police Car
description: A police car, shown with an emergency light on the top.

name: Oncoming Police Car
description: A police car, shown with an emergency light on the top.

name: Taxi
description: A yellow taxicab, iconically seen in New York City. Shown from the side, as opposed to the oncoming taxi emoji.

name: Oncoming Taxi
description: A yellow taxicab, iconically seen in New York City. Shown from the front, as opposed to the taxi emoji which displays the side of the vehicle.

name: Automobile
description: A car shown from the side, facing right-to-left. Appears as a red car on almost all platforms (which goes faster), though earlier Google designs displayed the vehicle as either silver or blue.

name: Oncoming Automobile
description: A car being shown from the front. The windscreen and hood (bonnet in British English) of the car can be seen facing forward.

name: Sport Utility Vehicle
description: A blue or green Sport Utility Vehicle or station wagon, often with a spare tire on the back. Commonly used as a generic blue or green car.

name: Pickup Truck
description: A red or turquoise pickup truck. Used to talk about trucks or modes of transportation in general.

name: Delivery Truck
description: Delivery Truck was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Articulated Lorry
description: Articulated Lorry was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Tractor
description: A tractor, may be used by a farmer or other occupation on the land.

name: Racing Car
description: A racing car which appears as a formula one vehicle or rally car on most platforms. Generally displayed in red.

name: Motorcycle
description: A motorcycle, otherwise known as a motorbike used for sport/racing purposes. For a transport-based motorcycle, use a motor scooter.

name: Motor Scooter
description: A motor scooter, which may be displayed as any type of motorbike with or without a step-through frame. Distinct from the racing motorcycle, which is used for sport, not transport.

name: Manual Wheelchair
description: A manual wheelchair. Most platforms show a red and black or blue and black wheelchair. Distinct from ♿ Wheelchair Symbol, which is used as signage to indicate accessible facilities. See also 👩‍🦽Woman in Manual Wheelchair or 👨‍🦽Man in Manual Wheelchair.

name: Motorized Wheelchair
description: A motorized wheelchair. Most platforms show a red and black or blue and black wheelchair. Distinct from ♿ Wheelchair Symbol which is used as signage to indicate accessible facilities. See also 👩‍🦼Woman in Motorized Wheelchair or 👨‍🦼Man in Motorized Wheelchair.

name: Auto Rickshaw
description: An auto rickshaw, often referred to as a tuk tuk. This motorized version of a cycle rickshaw is used for transport in many regions of the world. Generally this emoji has three wheels and open sides without doors.

name: Bicycle
description: A bicycle, sometimes called a push bike, used for transport or sport.

name: Kick Scooter
description: A non-motorized scooter, with two wheels and handles.

name: Skateboard
description: A skateboard emoji, usually showing the board from the top.

name: Roller Skate
description: A single vibrantly colored roller skate. Colors and styles vary across platform.

name: Bus Stop
description: A sign indicating the location of a bus stop by the side of a road.

name: Motorway
description: A wide road shown from a first person perspective. Apple's artwork displays a road sign to Curpertino.

name: Railway Track
description: Railway Track was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Oil Drum
description: A barrel for transporting bulk liquids, such as oil. Generally depicted as a red or blue metal drum with holes or a stopper on its lid. Commonly used for various content concerning petroleum or hazardous waste.

name: Fuel Pump
description: A fuel pump, used to fill up a vehicle with gas / petrol.

name: Wheel
description: A wheel with a rubber tire.

name: Police Car Light
description: A revolving red light seen on top of a police car. Often used in emergency circumstances in addition to a siren making a loud warning sound.

name: Horizontal Traffic Light
description: A set of red, orange (amber) and green traffic lights, used at intersections. Less common than the vertical traffic light.

name: Vertical Traffic Light
description: A set of red, orange (amber) and green traffic lights, used at intersections. More common than the horizontal traffic light.

name: Stop Sign
description: A red, octagonal sign. Used in many countries as a stop sign.

name: Construction
description: A sign used to indicate roadwork or construction. Generally shown as yellow and black diagonal stripes, and often used to physically block access to a road or area. May be used to imply a website or project in progress or under construction.

name: Anchor
description: A metal device, dropped out of a boat to prevent it drifting away from the current location.

name: Ring Buoy
description: A round white and orange or red ring buoy with string laced through its perimeter. Also called a life preserver.

name: Sailboat
description: A sailboat, otherwise known as a sailing boat or yacht.  Uses wind as the source of propulsion to move around a body of water.

name: Canoe
description: Canoe was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

name: Speedboat
description: A motorized speedboat used for recreation on lakes, or other bodies of water.

name: Passenger Ship
description: Passenger Ship was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Ferry
description: Ferry was approved as part of Unicode 5.2 in 2009 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Motor Boat
description: Motor Boat was approved as part of Unicode 7.0 in 2014 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Ship
description: A large ship, used for transport of people or cargo across the ocean. May be a cruise ship, commonly found around tropical locations.

name: Airplane
description: Used either as a literal airplane, to represent an overseas vacation, or sometimes as a proxy for airplane mode on a phone or tablet.

name: Small Airplane
description: A light aircraft which is shown with propellers on some platforms.

name: Airplane Departure
description: A plane taking off from a runway. Generally displayed left-right, with the front of the plane elevated.

name: Airplane Arrival
description: A plane approaching a runway for landing. Generally displayed left-right, with the front of the plane facing toward the ground in a position that may result in a crash if attempted in the real world.

name: Parachute
description: An open parachute floating through the air with a human steering. Most platforms feature a ram-air design. Colors vary across platforms.

name: Seat
description: A seat, which could refer to any form of place to sit, with the distinction that a seat is generally fixed, and is not a chair which can be moved.

name: Helicopter
description: A helicopter, which can hover in the air. Often seen in emergency circumstances such as transporting patients to a hospital, or for police or fire-fighting activity.

name: Suspension Railway
description: Similar to a monorail, a suspension railway is elevated, but the vehicle is suspended under the track.

name: Mountain Cableway
description: Mountain Cableway was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Aerial Tramway
description: An Aerial Tramway, most commonly seen at ski resorts, for transport between locations on a mountain. Can also be used as a tourist attraction, or as a form of public transport.

name: Satellite
description: A satellite which orbits the earth, and is generally used for communications, weather, and GPS.

name: Rocket
description: A rocket being propelled into space. Sometimes used to indicate a fast increase, for instance when referring to stocks going to the moon 🚀 (rising quickly in price).

name: Flying Saucer
description: A flying saucer, sometimes referred to as an Unidentified Flying Object (UFO). Previously shown on some platforms with an alien at the controls and/or a beam of light emitting from the base.

name: Bellhop Bell
description: Ding! A call bell, as pressed at a front desk or reception to alert staff for service, such as from a concierge or bellhop (porter) to carry luggage at a hotel. Generally depicted as a golden bell on a wooden stand.

name: Luggage
description: A suitcase or bag, as used for traveling. Most platforms depict gray or blue rolling luggage with an extended handle. Commonly used for various content concerning traveling or taking trips, whether for business or leisure.

name: Hourglass Done
description: A classic hourglass, all of its sand having flowed into the bottom bulb. Indicates time has passed. Color varies across platforms.

name: Hourglass Not Done
description: A classic hourglass, its sand still flowing from the top to bottom bulb. Indicates time is still passing—but life is short. Color varies across platforms.

name: Watch
description: A wristwatch, as used for telling time. Appearance varies across platforms, but widely depicted as an analog timepiece with a white face and brown or black straps.

name: Alarm Clock
description: A timepiece set in advance to startle a person awake at the designated time with its two bells. That is, before hitting snooze. Appearance varies across platforms, but depicted as a classic, wind-up, bedside alarm clock, often red in color.

name: Stopwatch
description: An analog, handheld timepiece used to measure elapsed time, as for athletic sprints. Appearance varies across platforms, but depicted with two or more control buttons on its top.

name: Timer Clock
description: Time’s up! A timer set to count down and sound an alarm after a designated amount of time, as used in the kitchen. Appearance varies by platform. Commonly used for various content concerning time, including countdowns and deadlines.

name: Mantelpiece Clock
description: An antique-styled mantel clock with a flat base and rounded case, as made of wood and brass and placed above a fireplace.

name: Twelve O’Clock
description: Twelve O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Twelve O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Twelve-Thirty
description: Twelve-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Twelve-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: One O’Clock
description: One O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face One O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: One-Thirty
description: One-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face One-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Two O’Clock
description: Two O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Two O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Two-Thirty
description: Two-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Two-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Three O’Clock
description: Three O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Three O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Three-Thirty
description: Three-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Three-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Four O’Clock
description: Four O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Four O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Four-Thirty
description: Four-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Four-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Five O’Clock
description: Five O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Five O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Five-Thirty
description: Five-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Five-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Six O’Clock
description: Six O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Six O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Six-Thirty
description: Six-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Six-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Seven O’Clock
description: Seven O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Seven O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Seven-Thirty
description: Seven-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Seven-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Eight O’Clock
description: Eight O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eight O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Eight-Thirty
description: Eight-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eight-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Nine O’Clock
description: Nine O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Nine O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Nine-Thirty
description: Nine-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Nine-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Ten O’Clock
description: Ten O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Ten O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Ten-Thirty
description: Ten-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Ten-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Eleven O’Clock
description: Eleven O’Clock was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eleven O’Clock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Eleven-Thirty
description: Eleven-Thirty was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Clock Face Eleven-Thirty” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: New Moon
description: A new moon, the first of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a full, bluish- or grayish-black, cratered disc, not illuminated by the sun.

name: Waxing Crescent Moon
description: A waxing crescent moon (appearing to become larger), the second of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, its right side illuminated in a thin, golden or silver crescent, its remainder dark.

name: First Quarter Moon
description: A first quarter moon, the third of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, its right half illuminated in gold or silver, its remainder dark.

name: Waxing Gibbous Moon
description: A waxing gibbous moon (appearing more than half full and getting larger), the fourth of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, mostly illuminated in gold or silver, but with its left side a dark crescent.

name: Full Moon
description: A full moon, the fifth phase of the eight phases of the moon, when it is completely lit. Depicts the moon as a full, gold or silver, cratered disc, completely illuminated by the sun.

name: Waning Gibbous Moon
description: A waning gibbous moon (appearing more than half full but getting smaller), the sixth of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, mostly illuminated in gold or silver, but with its right side a dark crescent.

name: Last Quarter Moon
description: A last quarter moon, the seventh of the eight phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, its left side half illuminated in gold or silver, its remainder dark.

name: Waning Crescent Moon
description: A waning crescent moon (appearing to become smaller), the last of the phases of the moon. Depicts the moon as a cratered disc, its left side illuminated in a thin, golden or silver crescent, its remainder dark.

name: Crescent Moon
description: A crescent moon, as in its waxing crescent phase. Depicts the moon as a thin, golden crescent, curving to the right and not displaying the remaining outline of the moon.

name: New Moon Face
description: A new moon with a smiling face, as the Man in the Moon. Generally depicts the moon as a dark disc with a slightly smiling human face and nose.

name: First Quarter Moon Face
description: A first quarter moon with a human face, as the Man in the Moon. Generally depicts a wide, golden crescent moon with the profile of a slightly smiling human face with a nose, facing left.

name: Last Quarter Moon Face
description: A last quarter moon with a human face, as the Man in the Moon. Generally depicts a wide, golden crescent moon with the profile of slightly smiling human face with a nose, facing right.

name: Thermometer
description: A liquid-in-glass thermometer, as used to measure temperature. Depicted at various angles with a red liquid risen from the bulb to various levels on the scale. Commonly used for content concerning high temperatures, including warm weather, illness (having a fever), and various slang senses of hot.

name: Sun
description: The sun, the star at the center of our solar system. Generally depicted as a golden-yellow disc radiating eight triangular rays, representing the sun’s heat and light.

name: Full Moon Face
description: A full moon with a smiling face, as the Man in the Moon. Generally depicts the moon as a dark disc with a slightly smiling human face and nose.

name: Sun with Face
description: A sun with a smiling face, as a Sun of May. Generally depicted as a golden-yellow disc with a smiling, often human face with a nose, radiating triangular rays, representing the sun's heat and light.

name: Ringed Planet
description: A ringed planet that appears with various number of rings, tilt angles, and colors across platforms. This vaguely Saturn-like orb was proposed as a stand-alone planet emoji to represent all planets.

name: Star
description: A classic, five-point gold star.

name: Glowing Star
description: A glowing, five-point gold star. Depicted as ⭐ Star with stylized bursts in between its points, representing glowing or twinkling.

name: Shooting Star
description: A stylized representation of a shooting star, a small, fast meteor that burns up in the atmosphere. Generally depicted as a gold, five-point star trailing yellow motion lines against a night sky, as if moving down to the left.

name: Milky Way
description: The Milky Way – a galaxy of billions of stars that includes our own solar system and planet earth.

name: Cloud
description: A fluffy, white cloud, as a cumulus. May be used as a weather icon to represent a cloudy or overcast day.

name: Sun Behind Cloud
description: A yellow sun half covered by a white cloud. Position of the sun varies across platforms.

name: Cloud with Lightning and Rain
description: Blue raindrops falling from a white cloud with a lightning bolt flashing.

name: Sun Behind Small Cloud
description: A yellow sun partially covered by a small, white cloud. Position of the cloud varies across platforms.

name: Sun Behind Large Cloud
description: A yellow sun mostly covered by a large, white cloud. Position of the sun varies across platforms.

name: Sun Behind Rain Cloud
description: A yellow sun half covered by a white rain cloud with blue raindrops. Most platforms depict the raindrops falling to the left. Position of the sun varies across platforms.

name: Cloud with Rain
description: A rain cloud. (Keep dry with ☔ Umbrella With Rain Drops.) Depicted as blue raindrops falling from a white cloud. Most platforms depict the raindrops falling to the left.

name: Cloud with Snow
description: A snow cloud. Depicted as blue snowflakes falling from a white cloud.

name: Cloud with Lightning
description: A thundercloud. Depicted as a yellow lightning bolt flashing from a white cloud.

name: Tornado
description: A tornado, a destructive column of air. Depicted as a gray, funnel-shaped cloud, rotating in contact with the ground.

name: Fog
description: Fog, as obscures visibility. Generally depicted as a square of a gray, hazy, cloud-like mass.

name: Wind Face
description: A face blowing the wind, as a personification of nature (e.g., Mother Nature, the North Wind) who creates the wind by blowing air from its mouth. Depicted as a gray, profile of a human face, generally with a feminine appearance, blowing swirls from her mouth to the right.

name: Cyclone
description: An icon used to represent a cyclone. Some versions of this emoji show a spiral shape, which may be used for decorative purposes.

name: Rainbow
description: The colorful arc of a rainbow, as may appear after rain. Generally depicted as the left half of a full rainbow, showing six bands of color: red, orange, yellow, green, blue, and violet.

name: Closed Umbrella
description: An umbrella that is closed, likely as a result of collapsing it prior to going indoors.

name: Umbrella
description: An opened, dry umbrella. Generally depicted with purple fabric and a hooked handle.

name: Umbrella with Rain Drops
description: An umbrella, opened to provide cover from rain. Generally depicted with purple fabric and a hooked handle with several rain droplets falling on its top.

name: Umbrella on Ground
description: A large, open umbrella, as provides shade at a beach or patio. Generally depicted as a striped umbrella inserted into a patch of sand and tilted to the right.

name: High Voltage
description: A symbol for high voltage, as warns against injury from electricity. Depicted as a jagged yellow bolt.

name: Snowflake
description: The unique, feathery ice crystal of a snowflake. Depicted as a bluish-white snowflake with six intricate symmetrical branches.

name: Snowman
description: A classic snowman, as Frosty the Snowman, with snowflakes falling on it. Depicted as a snowman, facing forward, made from two or three large snowballs and stick arms, dressed with a top hat, a carrot nose, coal eyes, and two or three buttons on its torso. Sometimes shown with a smile and a red scarf.

name: Snowman Without Snow
description: A classic snowman, as Frosty the Snowman. Depicted as a snowman, facing forward, made from two or three large snowballs and stick arms, dressed with a top hat, a carrot nose, coal eyes, and two or three buttons on its torso. Sometimes shown with a smile and a red scarf.

name: Comet
description: A comet, an icy, rocky space object that can form a tail of gas and dust when near the sun. Generally depicted as an icy-blue comet, as if streaking downwards in a night sky.

name: Fire
description: A flame, as produced when something is on fire. Depicted as a red, orange, and yellow flickering flame.

name: Droplet
description: A single, light blue droplet, as of water, sweat, or tears.

name: Water Wave
description: A wave of water, as breaks at the beach. Depicted as a blue wave with a foamy, white crest, curling to the right.

name: Jack-O-Lantern
description: An orange pumpkin carved into the shape of a face and commonly known as a Jack-o’-lantern. See also Halloween.

name: Christmas Tree
description: A classic Christmas tree, an evergreen tree decorated with lights and ornaments to celebrate Christmas.  Depicted with round, variously colored ornaments and topped with a yellow star.

name: Fireworks
description: Firework emoji, showing a explosion of colored light in the night sky, used for any number of celebrations such as New Year's Eve.

name: Sparkler
description: A  sparkler: a form of hand-held firework often used at parties and celebrations. The sparkler is lit at one end, and held at the other.

name: Firecracker
description: A firecracker, as lit on Chinese New Year, New Year's Eve, or Independence Day. Depicted as a red tube with a burning fuse, sometimes lined with gold rings at its top and base.

name: Sparkles
description: The glittering flashes of sparkles. Generally depicted as a cluster of three, yellow four-point stars, with one large sparkle and two small ones to its left or right.

name: Balloon
description: A balloon on a string, as decorates a birthday party. Generally depicted in red, though WhatsApp’s is pink and Google’s orangish-red.

name: Party Popper
description: A party popper, as explodes in a shower of confetti and streamers at a celebration. Generally depicted as a gold party hat, striped on some platforms, at a 45° angle, with multicolored confetti and streamers coming from its opening at the upper right. Twitter’s cone is red.

name: Confetti Ball
description: A golden ball, split in two halves in a shower of multicolored confetti and streamers.

name: Tanabata Tree
description: A Tanabata tree, a type of wish tree on which people hang wishes written on paper and other decorations during Tanabata, a Japanese festival celebrating two heavenly lovers. Depicted as one or two stalks of green bamboo, on which hangs one or more slips of paper, generally red.

name: Pine Decoration
description: A Japanese kadomatsu, composed of pine leaves and bamboo shoots. Traditionally placed outside homes in Japan around the New Year to welcome spirits for a plentiful, happy year ahead.

name: Japanese Dolls
description: Ornamental Japanese Emperor and Empress dolls, as displayed in celebration of Hinamatsuri on March 3 in Japan (Girls’ or Dolls’ Day).

name: Carp Streamer
description: Japanese koinobori, decorative, carp-shaped windsocks flown in celebration of Children’s Day on May 5 in Japan. Generally depicted as a blue and red stylized carp fish on a golden pole.

name: Wind Chime
description: A Japanese wind chime. Depicted as a glass bell with a strip of paper suspended from its clapper, often decorated with cherry blossom-like flowers.

name: Moon Viewing Ceremony
description: Moon Viewing Ceremonies (called Tsukimi in Japan) are held each year in autumn to celebrate the full moon and waxing moon in Japan.

name: Red Envelope
description: A red envelope, as gifted with money on Chinese New Year or on other joyous occasions, such as weddings, in Chinese and some other Asian cultures around the world.

name: Ribbon
description: A pink or red ribbon, as tied into a bow on a gift or woman's hat.

name: Wrapped Gift
description: A present or gift in a box tied with a bow, as given on a birthday or Christmas. Box and ribbon color vary across platforms, but commonly depicted as a gold box with a lid wrapped with a red ribbon.

name: Reminder Ribbon
description: An awareness ribbon, worn to show support of a cause or group.

name: Admission Tickets
description: A ticket or tickets to an event that may say "Admit One" on the front. Shown in pink or yellow on most platforms.

name: Ticket
description: A paper ticket, which may be for a theatre show, sporting event, or other ticketed performance. Shown in blue, yellow or grey on most platforms.

name: Military Medal
description: A ribbon and medallion generally awarded to a person in the military for heroic acts.

name: Trophy
description: A trophy given as an recognition of achievement, usually in sports. The trophy emoji is a gold cup, with a engraving on the bottom detailing the award.

name: Sports Medal
description: A gold medal, given to a person who has won a sporting event, such as a race. Not to be confused with the military medal emoji.

name: 1st Place Medal
description: 1st Place Medal was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 under the name “First Place Medal” and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

name: 2nd Place Medal
description: 2nd Place Medal was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 under the name “Second Place Medal” and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

name: 3rd Place Medal
description: 3rd Place Medal was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 under the name “Third Place Medal” and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

name: Soccer Ball
description: A round, black and white ball used in the game of soccer, which is known as football in much of the world. See also: emojis for the World Cup.

name: Baseball
description: A white baseball, with regulation red stitching. Used in the game of the same name, baseball.

name: Softball
description: A softball, which is differentiated from a baseball by size (it is larger, though hard to tell in emoji form) and color (yellow, not white).

name: Basketball
description: An orange-colored basketball. Originally intended to display as a basketball and a hoop, as per previous designs by Google, Samsung, and Microsoft.

name: Volleyball
description: A volleyball emoji, showing the round ball used in the sport. Played as part of the Summer Olympic Games.

name: American Football
description: The oval ball used in the game of American football, known as gridiron in some countries.

name: Rugby Football
description: The oval-shaped ball used in the game of rugby. Varies slightly in shape in the two main versions of the game: rugby union and rugby league.

name: Tennis
description: A tennis racket (racquet) with a tennis ball. Only a ball is shown on certain platforms, including Apple, Twitter, and WhatsApp.

name: Flying Disc
description: A flying disc, more commonly known as a frisbee. Used in the sport of Ultimate or disc golf.

name: Bowling
description: Ten-pin bowling emoji, showing a bowling ball and pins.

name: Cricket Game
description: A cricket bat, with a cricket ball also shown. May be displayed with a wicket present.

name: Field Hockey
description: A hockey stick and ball, used in the sport of field hockey. Not to be confused with the ice hockey stick and puck.

name: Ice Hockey
description: A hockey stick and puck, used in the sport of ice hockey. Not to be confused with the field hockey stick and ball.

name: Lacrosse
description: Lacrosse was approved as part of Unicode 11.0 in 2018 under the name “Lacrosse Stick and Ball” and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

name: Ping Pong
description: A paddle and ping pong ball used in the sport of table tennis.

name: Badminton
description: Badminton was approved as part of Unicode 8.0 in 2015 under the name “Badminton Racquet and Shuttlecock” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Boxing Glove
description: A padded boxing glove, used in the sport of boxing. Usually red.

name: Martial Arts Uniform
description: A white uniform used in marital arts such as judo or karate. Held together using a material belt. Known as keikogi in Japanese.

name: Goal Net
description: Goal Net was approved as part of Unicode 9.0 in 2016 and added to Emoji 3.0 in 2016.

name: Flag in Hole
description: A red, triangular flag shown sitting in the hole of a golf course green. Some versions of this emoji also include golf balls, with an early iOS design simply depicting a single golf ball.

name: Ice Skate
description: A single ice skate used for ice skating. Shown in white and facing right on most platforms.

name: Fishing Pole
description: A fishing rod (pole) with a fish caught on the end.

name: Diving Mask
description: A diving mask with a snorkel, used for scuba diving or other underwater activities. Colors vary across platforms.

name: Running Shirt
description: A singlet or running shirt. Shown with a sash.

name: Skis
description: A pair of skis which are shown on some platforms alongside ski poles and/or ski boots. The color and design of the skis varies by platform, with some versions also showing the skis moving at speed.

name: Sled
description: A sled, otherwise known as a toboggan or sledge.

name: Curling Stone
description: Curling Stone was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

name: Bullseye
description: A dart board with dart hitting the center / bullseye region.

name: Yo-Yo
description: A round yo-yo with its string coming out. It appears in various colors and designs across platforms, occasionally with a ⭐ Star on its side.

name: Kite
description: A diamond-shaped kite with a tail. This emoji appears in various colors across platforms.

name: Pool 8 Ball
description: This emoji displays the black 8 ball on most platforms, which looks similar to the Magic 8-Ball toy. This is despite the fact that emoji was originally created intending to represent game of billiards, of which pool is a common version.

name: Crystal Ball
description: A crystal ball, as a fortune teller or clairvoyant gazes into to tell the future. Depicted as a sparkling, purple or blue crystal orb resting on a stand.

name: Magic Wand
description: A wand with sparkles (✨magic✨) coming out of its end. Most platforms show a classic magician-style magic wand that's black with white tips. WhatsApp shows a golden magic wand tipped with a star, similar to the wand that Glenda the Good Witch uses in the 1939 film The Wizard of Oz.

name: Nazar Amulet
description: A nazar, an eye-shaped amulet believed to protect against the evil eye, especially in Turkish culture. Depicted as a rich blue, circular bead with a black dot in the center ringed with white and light blue, resembling an eye.

name: Hamsa
description: A blue hand with an eye in the center of the palm.

name: Video Game
description: A video game emoji, shown on major platforms as a console gamepad with D-pad, joysticks, and buttons.

name: Joystick
description: A joystick, as used in playing classic arcade, computer, or video games. Generally depicted with a black base, red-knobbed control stick, and one or more red buttons.

name: Slot Machine
description: A gambling machine generally found in casinos. Shows three wheels with a lever to the side. Most platforms display three 7 digits on this emoji.

name: Game Die
description: A six-sided die, used in a range of board and turn-based games. Commonly called dice which refers to the plural of die.

name: Puzzle Piece
description: Puzzle Piece was approved as part of Unicode 11.0 in 2018 under the name “Jigsaw Puzzle Piece” and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

name: Teddy Bear
description: A classic teddy bear, as snuggled by a child when going to sleep.

name: Piñata
description: A colorful decorated container that comes in many shapes, a piñata is filled with candy or toys. Hit to break open for celebrations such as Cinco de Mayo, this is generally associated with Mexico.

name: Mirror Ball
description: A mirror ball, also called a disco ball. A hanging sphere made up of a bunch of tiny mirrors, which reflect spots of light around a room, creating a party atmosphere.

name: Nesting Dolls
description: Nesting dolls, also called matryoshka dolls or Russian dolls, decorated with bright colors including red, yellow, blue, and green. All platforms depict the nesting dolls as open, revealing smaller dolls within the bases of larger dolls. Dolls are all decorated with women wearing headscarfs. Some platforms show a flower motif on the women's dresses or aprons.

name: Spade Suit
description: A spade symbol emoji, which is used in card games for the spades suit.

name: Heart Suit
description: A heart symbol emoji, used in card games for the hearts suit. In emoji form, this is most commonly used for love, affectiction, romance and positive intentions. Sometimes shown in a slightly darker shade of red than ❤️ Red Heart.

name: Diamond Suit
description: A diamond symbol emoji, which is used in card games for the diamonds suit.

name: Club Suit
description: A club symbol emoji, which is used in card games for the clubs suit.

name: Chess Pawn
description: Chess Pawn was approved as part of Unicode 1.1 in 1993 under the name “Black Chess Pawn” and added to Emoji 11.0 in 2018.

name: Joker
description: The joker in a deck of cards, usually appearing like a court jester.

name: Mahjong Red Dragon
description: The red dragon tile in the game of Japanese Mahjong. White, with red 中 character printed on it.

name: Flower Playing Cards
description: A type of cards known as hanafuda cards in Japan which are used for a range of different games that require associating pictures (there are no numbers on the cards).

name: Performing Arts
description: Two masks often used on maps to indicate a theatre, these originate in Greek Theatre as masks of tragedy and comedy.

name: Framed Picture
description: A framed picture of a painting or photograph, as displayed in a gallery or on a household wall. Vendors feature various scenes, though generally a lush, sunny landscape of hills and mountains, in a gold frame.

name: Artist Palette
description: A palette used by an artist when painting, to store and mix paint colors.

name: Thread
description: A spool of thread, as used for sewing. Thread color varies across platforms, though often depicted in red or blue and on a wooden spool. Sometimes shown with an end unraveling.

name: Sewing Needle
description: A threaded silver needle. Color of thread varies from platform to platform.

name: Yarn
description: A ball of yarn, as used to knit a scarf. Color varies across platforms, but often depicted in green, blue, or magenta and shown with an end unraveling. Sometimes depicted with a pair of knitting needles stuck in the ball.

name: Knot
description: Brightly colored rope forming a knot. Knot type varies across platform, with most designs showing a square knot, a figure eight knot, or a carrick bend. Samsung's design appears to be a carrick bend, but upon closer inspection, it is not correctly tied and would fall apart with a gentle tug.

name: Glasses
description: Prescription glasses, shown with a variety of frames, depending on platform.

name: Sunglasses
description: Sunglasses that can be worn outside for protection from the sun. Often association with connotations of being "cool", or leisurely in sunny places.

name: Goggles
description: Clear safety goggles. When this emoji was approved in 2018 it was implied to be safety goggles rather than swimming goggles. A year later 🤿 Diving Mask, which is similar in design but used to represent swimming goggles rather than safety goggles, was approved.

name: Lab Coat
description: A white coat worn in a science laboratory.

name: Safety Vest
description: An orange safety vest with reflective lines across the chest and over the shoulders.

name: Necktie
description: A necktie commonly worn at work or formal occasions, usually shown being worn with a shirt.

name: T-Shirt
description: A plain t-shirt, that can be worn by men or women. Displayed as a blue polo shirt on iOS, a light blue ringer t-shirt on Android, Samsung and Windows, or a standard green tee on other platforms.

name: Jeans
description: Denim jeans, worn by men or women. A popular form of casual trousers worn by the runner emoji in Apple's emoji artwork

name: Scarf
description: Scarf was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

name: Gloves
description: Gloves was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

name: Coat
description: A winter jacket, shown in a variety of colors and styles.

name: Socks
description: Socks was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

name: Dress
description: A pretty dress, suitable for a ball, party or other similar occasion.

name: Kimono
description: A traditional Japanese robe that can be worn by women or men.

name: Sari
description: A brightly colored sari draped in different ways across platforms. Sometimes used to mean a dress in general.

name: One-Piece Swimsuit
description: A sporty one-piece swimsuit shown in a variety of colors and patterns across different platforms.

name: Briefs
description: Underwear or swim briefs. The swimming variety are often called 'Speedos' after the brand. This emoji is shown in different colors and styles across platforms. Some platforms depict this emoji as tighty whities with a visible fly, while others use a less specific design.

name: Shorts
description: Shorts or swimming trunks. This emoji is shown in different colors and styles across platforms. Most platforms depict this emoji in a casual sporty style.

name: Bikini
description: A two-piece bikini, worn at the beach, pool, or on vacation at a tropical destination.

name: Woman’s Clothes
description: A blouse worn by women in a neat-casual setting.

name: Purse
description: A small pouch with a clasp, generally used to hold coins. Sometimes called a “coin purse.”

name: Handbag
description: A bag or purse, used to carry personal items, often doubling as a fashion accessory.

name: Clutch Bag
description: A small pouch, somewhere between the size of a handbag, and a purse.

name: Folding Hand Fan
description: A brightly colored folding hand fan.

name: Shopping Bags
description: Two colorful shopping bags, as contain consumer items bought at a department store. Depicted as gift bags in various bright colors, patterns, sizes, and positions across platforms. Apple's design, for instance, features a pink bag with light-pink dots in front of a gold bag with yellow stripes.

name: Backpack
description: A school bag Emoji (also called a satchel) used by children attending school to carry books, lunch, and other personal belongings.

name: Thong Sandal
description: A single flip flop or thong sandal. Often worn to the beach and/or in warm weather. Can be used to talk about sandals, the beach, or warm weather in general.

name: Man’s Shoe
description: A shoe worn by a man, to work, dinner, or another occasion that requires footwear. Unlike womens shoes, this shoe is likely to be comfortable.

name: Running Shoe
description: A sneaker – a comfortable shoe used in sports such as tennis or golf, or for fashion purposes.

name: Hiking Boot
description: A style of boot commonly worn on long walks or for hiking. Generally distinct from other footwear-related emojis by the considerable grip on the sole of the shoe.

name: Flat Shoe
description: A flat shoe, in a style generally worn by women. More practical than a high-heeled shoe.

name: High-Heeled Shoe
description: A high-heeled shoe, primarily worn by women. Generally found in a context which requires formal dress, such as social occasions, or some work places.

name: Woman’s Sandal
description: A sandal worn by a woman in summer, spring, or other weather that suits open-toed footwear. Has a heel at the back providing additional height to the wearer.

name: Ballet Shoes
description: Shoes worn by ballet dancers for pointe work. Most platforms show a pair of pink shoes resting on their pointes. Sometimes used to represent dancing in general, rather than ballet specifically. Sometimes also used to represent the color pink.

name: Woman’s Boot
description: A tall boot generally featuring a slight heel, shown in brown or red on most platforms.

name: Crown
description: A gold crown with jewels on the sides. Representative of a King, Queen, or other form of Royalty.

name: Woman’s Hat
description: A hat worn by women for sun protection, or for fashion.

name: Top Hat
description: A top hat, worn in traditional British weddings and other formal occasions. This is also a popular playing piece in the game of Monopoly.

name: Graduation Cap
description: A graduation cap, worn on the head of students graduating from college or university. Known in some locations as a mortar board with tassel.

name: Billed Cap
description: Billed Cap was approved as part of Unicode 10.0 in 2017 and added to Emoji 5.0 in 2017.

name: Military Helmet
description: A round military helmet with a chinstrap. All platforms depict a green helmet, with some designs featuring a green camouflage pattern.

name: Rescue Worker’s Helmet
description: A construction helmet, which is worn by the construction worker emoji in some emoji sets.

name: Prayer Beads
description: A string of beads, as used in prayer or meditation in many religious traditions. Generally depicted as red, wooden beads with a gold, decorative center bead and tassel.

name: Lipstick
description: Lipstick shown with the lid removed. Displays in a shade of red on most platforms, except WhatsApp and Twitter which have a more a pinkish color.

name: Hair Pick
description: A hair pick with a handle and several long teeth. Used to style hair, especially thick, curly hair. May be used as a symbol of Black culture or Black pride.

name: Ring
description: A ring with displaying a gem stone of some kind on the top, most likely a diamond. This piece of jewellery is often associated with a proposal and subsequent engagement to be married.

name: Gem Stone
description: A jewel or gem, as set into a ring. Depicted in the shape of a classic diamond but in the bright blue color of an aquamarine.

name: Muted Speaker
description: A speaker with a red line through it, indicating muted volume or silencing of audio.

name: Speaker Low Volume
description: A speaker cone displayed without any sound waves.

name: Speaker Medium Volume
description: A speaker cone displayed with one sound wave, generally used as an icon to indicate the decreasing of volume on a phone or computer.

name: Speaker High Volume
description: A speaker cone displayed with three sound waves, generally used as an icon to indicate the increasing of volume on a phone or computer.

name: Loudspeaker
description: A loudspeaker used to make announcements in public areas such as schools, or sporting grounds.

name: Megaphone
description: Megaphone was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 under the name “Cheering Megaphone” and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Postal Horn
description: A postal horn (post horn). Depicted as a coiled, valveless, brass horn, like a bugle or trumpet, with two red tassels. Sometimes used to mark announcements as well as for various content concerning brass instruments, music, or mail.

name: Bell
description: A gold or yellow bell, which is commonly used on mobile phones as an icon for notifications or ringing sounds.

name: Bell with Slash
description: A gold or yellow bell with a red line through it, which is commonly used on mobile phones as an icon for the silencing of notifications or ringing sounds. A mute, or silent mode.

name: Musical Score
description: A staff (or stave) showing a treble clef and five horizontal lines.

name: Musical Note
description: A music note emoji, which can denote song lyrics, or other music related topics.

name: Musical Notes
description: Three eighth notes (quavers in British English), used to represent music or singing. Sometimes inserted next to quoted lyrics, to make it clear that they are part of a song.

name: Studio Microphone
description: A microphone, as used for radio broadcasting or studio recording. Most platforms depict a vintage, silver microphone, like the Shure Unidyne 55.

name: Level Slider
description: A level slider, as adjusts volume on a mixing console. Most platforms depict a silver and black channel fader with scale markings, set to various levels. Apple and Google's go up to eleven.

name: Control Knobs
description: Four control knobs, as adjust audio levels on a mixing console. Generally depicted as a silver square with black knobs, turned to various levels as indicated by white pointers and scale markings.

name: Microphone
description: A microphone, used to amplify a person’s voice when speaking or singing.

name: Headphone
description: Headphones, used to listen to music or other forms audio, such as podcasts. Most platforms display this emoji with large over-ear headphones in shades of black, blue, and gray.

name: Radio
description: A classic portable radio, as used to listen to music, news, or sports. Depicted in various colors and styles with a speaker, antenna, dial, and knobs.

name: Saxophone
description: Saxophone was approved as part of Unicode 6.0 in 2010 and added to Emoji 1.0 in 2015.

name: Accordion
description: A red accordion with a keyboard on one side, buttons on the other side, and bellows in the middle. Used to talk about accordion music or music in general. Also may be used in reference to things that expand and contract, or are folded like the bellows of an accordion.

name: Guitar
description: A guitar, which most platforms display as a red electric guitar.

name: Musical Keyboard
description: A small section of a music keyboard, which differs from a computer keyboard.

name: Trumpet
description: A trumpet, a brass instrument played in jazz bands.

name: Violin
description: A violin emoji. Sometimes used in the context of the world’s smallest violin.

name: Banjo
description: A banjo with a round body and a long neck. Used to talk about banjos or music in general.

name: Flute
description: A simple yellow flute made of bamboo, plastic, or metal.

name: Drum
description: A drum shown with drumsticks. A percussion instrument which is likely to be displayed as a snare drum.music, instrument,

name: Long Drum
description: A long drum with a tall body and a cylindrical or hourglass shell. Can be used to represent various drums found around the world from Africa to the Caribbean to Latin America to Asia. Types of long drum include (but are not limited to) djembe, talking drum, conga, bongo, tumbadora, atabaque, and dhol.

name: Maracas
description: A set of maracas with a colorful motif painted on them.

name: Mobile Phone
